title: Vedic Mathematics: Ancient Techniques for Modern Problem Solving
text:
Abstract
This talk explores the system of mental calculation known as “Vedic Mathematics,” based on principles derived from ancient Indian mathematical texts. We’ll examine how these techniques provide elegant and efficient methods for arithmetic, algebra, and geometry, and discuss their pedagogical value in contemporary mathematics education.


About the Speaker
Dr. Amartya K Dutta is a Professor at the Indian Statistical Institute, Kolkata. His research interests include commutative algebra, algebraic geometry, and the history of Indian mathematics. He has published extensively on both modern mathematical topics and historical Indian mathematical traditions.

title: History of Mathematics in India: Seminar Series
text:
Welcome to the homepage for the HOMI (History of Mathematics in India) seminar series! This is a virtual monthly seminar series, where we discuss the rich mathematical heritage of India from ancient Vedic times to the modern era, exploring both historical developments and their contemporary relevance.






 We meet over Zoom at 17:00 IST on the third Wednesday of each month. If the link does not work, you can use the meeting ID 986 5191 2771 with passcode ZERO.



We also welcome you to suggest a seminar! Feel free to sign yourself up, or someone you want to hear, or just share a topic that you want to learn about. You can do this by sending an email to homi.iitgn@gmail.com.

title: History of Permutations and Combinations
The Kerala School of Mathematics: Contributions and Legacy
text:
Abstract
This talk will explore the remarkable contributions of the Kerala School of Mathematics (14th-16th centuries), focusing on their pioneering work in infinite series, calculus, and astronomy. We’ll discuss how these mathematicians, including Madhava of Sangamagrama, developed sophisticated mathematical techniques centuries before similar developments in Europe, and examine their enduring legacy in the history of mathematics.


About the Speaker
Dr. K. Ramasubramanian is a Professor at the Cell for Indian Science and Technology in Sanskrit, IIT Bombay. He specializes in Indian mathematics, astronomy, and scientific heritage. He has translated several ancient mathematical texts and is a recipient of the prestigious Maharshi Badarayan Vyas Samman award.
